task: Diseña una arquitectura que permita la operar con criptomonedas

decomposition.intro: I approached the task of designing a cryptocurrency-operating architecture by identifying key functional areas that are essential for the successful implementation of such a system. In this case, I have identified five areas that cover different aspects of the architecture, including security, transaction processing, user management, integration with blockchain networks, and scalability.

subtasks.description: Responsible for ensuring the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of the cryptocurrency operations.
responsibilities: Implementing robust encryption mechanisms to protect sensitive data.
Setting up secure authentication and authorization processes.
Monitoring for and responding to security incidents promptly.

subtasks.description: Manages the processing of cryptocurrency transactions within the architecture.
responsibilities: Validating transactions to ensure they comply with the system's rules.
Recording transactions accurately in the ledger.
Facilitating fast and efficient transaction confirmation.

subtasks.description: Handles user accounts, profiles, and interactions within the cryptocurrency system.
responsibilities: User registration, authentication, and profile management.
Managing user permissions and access levels.
Providing support for user inquiries and issue resolution.

subtasks.description: Integrates the architecture with blockchain networks to leverage their capabilities.
responsibilities: Synchronizing with blockchain nodes to retrieve and update transaction data.
Implementing smart contracts for automated and secure transactions.
Ensuring compatibility and interoperability with various blockchain protocols.

subtasks.description: Focuses on designing the architecture to handle increasing loads and user demands.
responsibilities: Implementing load balancing mechanisms for distributing traffic efficiently.
Optimizing database and storage systems for scalability.
Monitoring performance metrics and scaling resources as needed.
